intro: Salvia pontica, commonly known as the Pontic sage, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces striking violet-blue flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or limestone areas, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Salvia pontica is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
